itemListElement.name: Roasted Butternut Squash Apple Cranberry Salad with harrissa Spiced Pecans

@graph.name: Roasted Butternut Squash Apple Cranberry Salad with harrissa Spiced Pecans
@graph.description: Roasted Butternut Squash Apple Cranberry Salad with harrissa Spiced Pecans. Easy Thanksgiving Salad. Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 1/2  large butternut squash (cubed or use 1.5 cups frozen)
1/2 tsp dried thyme or 2 tsp fresh (chopped)
freshly ground black pepper to taste
1.5 tsp or more dry harissa spice blend
lemon juice (olive oil or balsamic vinegar as dressing)

recipeInstructions.text: Toss the butternut cubes in oil, salt, pepper and thyme. Spread on a baking sheet and bake at 400 degrees F / 200ºc until tender. (25 to 35 minutes depending on the size of the cubes). Or cook in a skillet over medium heat. Add a splash of water, cover and cook until tender. Stir after 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Toss the butternut cubes in oil, salt, pepper and thyme. Spread on a baking sheet and bake at 400 degrees F / 200ºc until tender. (25 to 35 minutes depending on the size of the cubes). Or cook in a skillet over medium heat. Add a splash of water, cover and cook until tender. Stir after 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Toast the pecans in a skillet over medium heat until lightly toasted. 4 to 5 minutes. Add oil and harrisa spice blend. Toss to coat. Cook until the pecans are toasted to preference.
recipeInstructions.name: Toast the pecans in a skillet over medium heat until lightly toasted. 4 to 5 minutes. Add oil and harrisa spice blend. Toss to coat. Cook until the pecans are toasted to preference.

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, toss or layer the greens, cranberries, apples, roasted butternut and spicy pecans. Dress with salt and generous dash of pepper. Add a drizzle of lemon juice or balsamic just before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, toss or layer the greens, cranberries, apples, roasted butternut and spicy pecans. Dress with salt and generous dash of pepper. Add a drizzle of lemon juice or balsamic just before serving.
